availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Kirkpatrick (Louisville, Ky, policeman & police chief)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, policeman. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Kirkpatrick. Father of Elizabeth Kirkpatrick, Alice R. Kirkpatrick, Sarah B. Kirkpatrick, and William R. Kirkpatrick. Day policeman in the 5th Ward in Louisville, Kentucky. Chief of police in Louisville from March 1856 to 1857.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 5, p. 153-154.

Morton O. Childress, "Louisville Police Department" in The Encyclopedia of Louisville, ed. John E. Kleber (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 506.
